isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - THIRTEEN-SPEED AUXILIARY

figure.caption: Figure 229. 13-Speed Auxiliary

step1.para: Lubricate all the parts of the auxiliary cover with new oil used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Put timing marks on the OD gear. Mark one tooth with paint. Mark a second tooth opposite (180 degrees) the first timing mark (Figure 230).

figure.caption: Figure 230. Put Timing Marks on OD Gear

step1.para: Put the output shaft on the work bench. Make sure the splined end of the shaft is up.
Install the spacer on the output shaft. Make sure the small shoulder of the spacer is toward the splined end of the shaft for the output yoke (Figure 231).

figure.caption: Figure 231. Install Spacer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Install the auxiliary OD gear on the output shaft (Figure 232).

figure.caption: Figure 232. Install Auxiliary OD Gear on Output Shaft

step1.para: Put the output shaft and OD gear assembly on a press. Support the shaft on the bottom of the shaft. Make sure the large threads on the shaft are toward the top of the press.
Install a bearing cone on the shaft. Make sure the letters on the cone assembly are toward the gear (Figure 233).
Put a sleeve on the cone. Press the cone on the shaft until the cone touches the gear. Make sure the gear and bearing cone rotates on the shaft ( Figure 233).

figure.caption: Figure 233. Install Bearing Cone

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft (Figure 234).

figure.caption: Figure 234. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Put the auxiliary cover in a press so that the outside of the cover is toward the top of the press.
Put the inner bearing cup in the cover. Make sure the letters on the cup are toward you. Install a sleeve or a bearing installation tool on the race of the bearing.
Press the inner cup into the cover until the top of the cup is 3/8 inch below the outer surface of the cover (Figure 235).

figure.caption: Figure 235. Press Inner Cup into Cover

step1.para: Put the outer cup on top of the inner cup. Make sure the letters on the cup are toward you ( Figure 236).

Put a sleeve or installation tool on the top of the outer cup. Press both cups into the bore. The cups are correctly installed when the flange on the outer cup touches the shoulder in the bore of the cover (Figure 236).

figure.caption: Figure 236. Put Outer Cup on Top of Inner Cup

step1.para: Put the output shaft and OD gear assembly in a press. Put a support under the gear. Make sure the large threads on the shaft are toward the top of the press.
Put the auxiliary cover on the output shaft assembly. Rotate the cover to make sure the output shaft inner bearing cone is installed in the cup.
Install the spacer on the top of the inner bearing cone of the output shaft.
Install the outer bearing cone on the output shaft. Make sure the letters on the cone are toward the top of the press.
Install a sleeve on the outer bearing cone. Press the cone on the shaft and into the cup in the bore of the cover (Figure 237).

figure.caption: Figure 237. Press Cone on Shaft

step1.para: Put the gear and cover assembly on a bench. Make sure the inside of the cover is toward you.
Use paint to put timing marks on two teeth of each countershaft OD gear. Make sure the mark is aligned with the dot on the countershaft (Figure 238).

figure.caption: Figure 238. Put Timing Marks on Teeth of Countershaft OD Gear

step1.para: Install the shaft in the fork. Make sure the holes in the shaft and fork are aligned ( Figure 239).

figure.caption: Figure 239. Install Shaft in Fork

step1.para: Install the bolt. Tighten to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install a new lockwire in the bolt and fork.
Install the low synchronizer on the hub and LO gear assembly (Figure 240).

figure.caption: Figure 240. Install Low Synchronizer on Hub and LO Gear Assembly

step1.para: Put the countershaft in a press so that the auxiliary gear is toward the bottom of the press. Support the countershaft on the gear.
Put the key in the groove on the shaft.
Put the splitter gear on the shaft. Make sure the key is aligned with the slot in the gear.
Put a sleeve on the gear and press the gear on the shaft (Figure 241).

figure.caption: Figure 241. Press Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Put the rear cone on the countershaft so that the bottom of the cone is toward the gear.
Put a sleeve on the inner race of the cone. Press the cone on the countershaft. The cone is correctly installed when the bottom of the cone touches the gear (Figure 242).

figure.caption: Figure 242. Press Cone on Countershaft

step1.para: Turn the countershaft over so that the splitter gear is toward the bottom of the press.
Put the front cone on the countershaft so that the bottom of the cone is toward the gear.
Put a sleeve on the inner race of the cone. Press the cone on the countershaft. The cone is correctly installed when the bottom of the cone touches the gear (Figure 243).

figure.caption: Figure 243. Press Front Cone on Countershaft

step1.para: Install the auxiliary countershafts in the cover. Make sure the timing marks on the OD gears are aligned. Make sure the countershaft bearing is completely installed in the cover (Figure 244).

figure.caption: Figure 244. Install Auxiliary Countershafts in Cover

step1.para: Install the collar on the output shaft. Install the splitter fork and shaft assembly on the splitter gear assembly. Move the fork so that the fork will not touch the splitter gear assembly during installation (Figure 245).

figure.caption: Figure 245. Install Collar, and Install Splitter Fork and Shaft Assembly

step1.para: Install the LO gear and synchronizer assembly on the output shaft inside the auxiliary cover. Make sure the high synchronizer is toward you. Makes sure the timing marks on all the gears are aligned (Figure 246).

note.para: The end play of the auxiliary countershaft is checked when the auxiliary cover is installed on the transmission.

figure.caption: Figure 246. Install LO Gear and Synchronizer Assembly

step1.para: Design Level 1 Transmissions: install the cups on the cones of the auxiliary countershafts. Install the correct selective snap rings that fasten the cups in the cover. Make sure the snap ring is completely installed in the groove (Figure 247).

Design Level 2 Transmissions: install the cups on the cones of the auxiliary countershafts. Install the correct selective washers in front of the cups. Make sure the tabs in the washers are in the slots in the case.

figure.caption: Figure 247. Install Correct Selective Snap Rings

step1.para: Put the holding plates on both auxiliary countershafts. Use bolts to fasten the plates to the countershaft and cover. DO NOT CHANGE THE POSITION OF THE TRANSMISSION IN THE REPAIR STAND (Figure 248).

figure.caption: Figure 248. Put Holding Plates on Auxiliary Countershafts

step1.para: Install a new nut and washer that fasten the LO gear to the output shaft. Tighten the nut to 298 to 353 Nm (220 to 260 ft-lbs.) (Figure 249).

figure.caption: Figure 249. Install New Nut and Washer

step1.para: Put the HI-LO shift fork in position so that the fork engages the synchronizer collar. Makes sure the bore of the fork is aligned with the bore of the piston housing. Make sure the lock pin hole in the fork is installed away from the cover (Figure 250).

Install the HI-LO shift shaft from inside the front of the auxiliary cover. Make sure the threads on the end of the shaft are installed first. Rotate the shaft while pushing the shaft through the O-ring ( Figure 250).

note.para: If a pin and clip were used to fasten the HI-LO fork to the shaft, replace the pin and clip with a nut and shoulder bolt.

step1.para: Align the hole of the shaft with the hole of the shift fork. Install the bolt and lock nut. Tighten the nut to 11 to 16 Nm (8 to 12 ft-lbs.) (Figure 250).

figure.caption: Figure 250. Install HI-LO Shift Shaft

step1.para: Move the cover in the fixture so that the outside of the cover is toward you.
Use a suitable tool to install a new bushing for the speedometer gear inside the output bearing retainer.

Install a new oil seal in the output bearing retainer (Figure 251). Lubricate the outer diameter of the seal. Put the oil seal in the cover. Make sure the letters on the seal are installed away from the retainer.

caution.para: Hold the seal only on the outer diameter. Do not touch the inner diameter of the seal. Touching contaminates the inner diameter of the seal and causes a leak between the shaft and seal.
Use the correct tool to install the oil seal. If the correct tool is not used, the seal will leak.

step1.para: Use seal driver tool ZTSE-4424 to drive the seal into the cover. The seal is correctly installed when the flange of the seal touches the retainer.

figure.caption: Figure 251. Install New Oil Seal in Output Bearing Retainer

step1.para: Use a sealant dispenser and Loctite RTV Sealant #5699 or equivalent to make a 3 mm (1/8 inch) gasket pattern on the cover for the output bearing retainer. Refer to Figure 252 for the gasket pattern. Refer to INSTALLING THE SEALANT section.
Install the output bearing retainer on the auxiliary cover. Make sure the oil passage in the retainer is aligned over the oil hole in the cover (Figure 252).

figure.caption: Figure 252. Gasket Pattern

step1.para: Install the mounting bolts for the output bearing retainer. Tighten the bolts to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).

Lubricate the O-rings and bores of the piston housing with a silicone lubricant such as Dow Corning #111 Silicone Grease or equivalent. Install the O-rings in the grooves in the bores of the piston housing (Figure 253).

figure.caption: Figure 253. Install O-Rings in Grooves

step1.para: Use a sealant dispenser and Loctite RTV Sealant #5699 or equivalent to make a gasket pattern on the piston housing. Refer to Figure 254 for the gasket pattern. Refer to INSTALLING THE SEALANT section.

figure.caption: Figure 254. Make Gasket Pattern on Piston Housing

step1.para: Install piston housing on the auxiliary cover. Make sure the shafts are in the correct bores ( Figure 255).
Lubricate the O-ring for the pistons with a silicone lubricant such as Dow Corning #111 Silicone Grease or equivalent. Install the O-rings on the outer diameter and in the bore of the pistons.
Install the pistons on the shafts in the piston housings. Make sure the pistons are installed on the correct shafts (Figure 255).

figure.caption: Figure 255. Install O-Ring and Install Pistons

step1.para: Install a new nut and washer that fasten the pistons on the shafts. Tighten the nut to 47 to 68 Nm (35 to 50 ft-lbs.) (Figure 256).
Lubricate the O-rings on the shuttle valve with a silicone lubricant such as Dow Corning #111 Silicone Grease or equivalent.
Install the shuttle valve. Make sure the rod of the valve is toward the piston. Install and tighten the fitting (Figure 256).

figure.caption: Figure 256. Install Shuttle Valve

step1.para: Install a new gasket between the piston housing and piston housing cover.
Install the bolts and washers that fasten the piston housing cover to the piston housing. Tighten the bolts to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install the cups for the rear bearing cones of the auxiliary countershafts ( Figure 257).

figure.caption: Figure 257. Install Cups for Rear Bearing Cones
